title: Venture Global Wins Repsol Arbitration Case
description: ICC tribunal denies all Repsol claims over Calcasieu Pass commissioning delays, marking VG's second arbitration victory.

title: Venture Global Lowers FY2025 EBITDA Guidance
description: VG cuts full-year EBITDA guidance to $6.18B-$6.24B from $6.35B-$6.50B due to volatile LNG prices and Q4 shipping constraints.

title: JPMorgan Downgrades VG to Neutral, Sets $10 Price Target
description: JPMorgan cuts VG rating citing near-term supply additions pressuring LNG prices and uncertainty around arbitration payouts.

title: Shell Challenges VG Arbitration Ruling in New York Court
description: Shell files challenge alleging Venture Global withheld critical evidence in the Calcasieu Pass arbitration, including communications with Lummus Consultants.

title: US LNG Exports Hit Record in 2025 as New Capacity Comes Online
description: US LNG exports reached record levels in 2025, driven by Plaquemines LNG commissioning and full Calcasieu Pass operations. The US now exports more LNG than any other country.

title: European Gas Storage Falls Below 60% Ahead of Winter Peak
description: EU gas storage levels have dropped below 60% for the first time this winter, supporting TTF prices and maintaining strong US-to-Europe LNG arbitrage.

title: CP2 LNG Phase 1 Construction Progress: 3,500 Workers On Site
description: Venture Global reports CP2 site preparation 88% complete with over 3,500 workers deployed. LNG tank construction at 28% and engineering essentially complete at 99.5%.

title: Plaquemines LNG Expansion: FERC Application Filed for 32 Additional Trains
description: Venture Global filed a formal FERC application for a brownfield expansion at Plaquemines LNG, adding 32 trains and over 30 MTPA capacity.

title: Henry Hub Natural Gas Surges to $4.98 on Cold Weather
description: Cold weather across the US Southeast drives Henry Hub spot prices to $4.98/MMBtu, the highest in three months, compressing LNG export margins.

title: Panama Canal Restrictions Reroute 94% of US LNG to Asia via Cape
description: Transit restrictions at the Panama Canal mean nearly all US LNG bound for Asia takes the Cape of Good Hope route, adding 20 days and approximately $0.80/MMBtu to shipping costs.
